title: Horrible Silver player looking for a team. Been playing since 2009
body:
I know i should give it up, but am addicted to it.
I have been playing since the beta days and have not got much 'beta'. Any chance there's a higher elo, non serious team who would like to have me on board to teach me to play a bit better? Im a bit shy to Skype with, but may warm up to it if we have a more games etc.

I like to play ADC and Sup, thats about it. Can sorta jungle with nunu and rammus, not much else.

replies.body: i fail to see how some one wanting to improve is funny?
just because i get laid and you dont doesnt mean im a hoe
i have a life out side of lol forums
I can try coach you a bit, would be better if you ask for coaching instead, since lets be real, ranked 5s in oce isnt really good for learning how to get better at the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Cookie,realm=OCE,application-id=mR0UmRrp,discussion-id=r5waEorM,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-05T12:22:04.476+0000)
>
> I can try coach you a bit, would be better if you ask for coaching instead, since lets be real, ranked 5s in oce isnt really good for learning how to get better at the game.

Thanks for the offer anyways. 

Could you elaborate a bit more on why ranked 5s wouldn't be beneficial for learning?  I thought not all ranked 5 teams were serious. Do you mean going into duo que to learn with a higher elo player who could coach? Or recording my games and being told what I could of done etc to get better?

Cheers,

The last one is actually the best way to improve.  You see if you duo que with a high elo player, you wont really learn as much as him pointing out every single mistake you make after the game on a recording. This is due to him forced to focus on what hes doing. Also if its recorded he can be more nitpicky. If you dont want me to coach you , or you dont want to pay for one, I can recommend you to last shadow's youtube videos. Type in last shdow in youtube. SOme of his coaching is a bit awkward at times,but that is basically what coaching is like,and if you watch it for the first time, it will show you a lot of things to improve on, aside from csing
